begin with green - stuff as you go 1 work 6 single_crochet in a magic_ring 6 2 single_crochet increase around 9 3 single_crochet increase single_crochet around 12 4 single_crochet around 12 5 3 single_crochet increase around 15 6 2 single_crochet increase 2 single_crochet around 18 7 single_crochet around 18 8 5 single_crochet increase around 21 9 3 single_crochet increase 3 single_crochet around 24 10 7 single_crochet increase around 27 11 4 single_crochet increase 4 single_crochet around 30 12 single_crochet around 30 13 9 single_crochet increase around 33 14 5 single_crochet increase 5 single_crochet around 36 15 11 single_crochet increase around 39 16 6 single_crochet increase 6 single_crochet around 42 17 20 single_crochet around 42 21 6 single_crochet decrease 6 single_crochet around 39 22 11 single_crochet decrease around 36 23 5 single_crochet decrease 5 single_crochet around 33 24 9 single_crochet decrease around 30 25 single_crochet around 30 26 4 single_crochet decrease 4 single_crochet around 27 27 7 single_crochet decrease around 24 28 3 single_crochet decrease 3 single_crochet around 21 29 5 single_crochet decrease around 18 30 single_crochet around 18 31 2 single_crochet decrease 2 single_crochet around 15 32 3 single_crochet decrease around 12 33 single_crochet around 12 34 single_crochet decrease single_crochet around 9 35 single_crochet decrease around 6 - f/o sew shut copyright © 2022 icrochetthings 4/ assembly use green yarn to embroider a line of chain stitches around the middle of the plumbob between rounds 18 and 19 you should have 42 total chain stitches mark every 7 th chain stitch so 6 total stitches are marked starting from round embroider a straight line of chain stitches up to one of the 2 marked stitches go past the marked stitch then continue to embroider a straight line of chain stitches up to round 34 repeat the previous step for each of the remaining marked stitches until you have 6 lines of chain stitches running up the plumbob copyright © 2022 icrochetthings
